doc:
Mark Fenton https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Fenton 0 Mark Fenton (November 11, 1866 – July 29, 1925) was an American actor of the silent film era. Fenton had a sturdy theatrical and Broadway career behind him before coming to silent pictures. His early stage experience came in Charles Frohman's productions. His Broadway credits included Francesca da Rimini (1901), Twelfth Night (1900), Mary Stuart (1900), Marie Antoinette (1900), The Ladies' Battle (1900), Macbeth (1900), and Much Ado About Nothing (1900).He appeared in 80 films between 1915 and 1925. Fenton was born in Crestline, Ohio and died after surgery following an automobile accident in Los Angeles, California. Mark_Fenton ( November_11 , 1866 – July_29_,_1925 ) was an_American_actor of the_silent_film_era . Fenton had a_sturdy_theatrical and Broadway_career behind him before coming to silent_pictures . His_Broadway_credits included Francesca_da_Rimini_(_1901_) , Twelfth_Night_(_1900_) , Mary_Stuart (_1900_) , Marie_Antoinette_(_1900_) , The_Ladies '_Battle_(_1900_) , Macbeth_(_1900_) , and Much_Ado About Nothing_(_1900_) . He appeared in 80_films between 1915_and_1925 . Fenton was_born in Crestline_,_Ohio_and died after surgery following an_automobile_accident in Los_Angeles , California .
